response.job_title: Post-doctoral researcher in Electrical Engineering | Power Systems | Artificial Intelligence | Optimization | EN, ES, PT
response.summary:
I am an electronic and electrical engineer with a double degree from the National University of Colombia. I hold an MSc. and a Ph.D. in electrical engineering from the University of Campinas.

Throughout my academic journey, I have conducted extensive research in various areas, including photovoltaic devices, atmospheric discharges, transmission lines, and optimization using both classical and heuristic methods. To carry out these research projects, I have utilized programming languages such as Python, Matlab, and C#. One of my recent research endeavors involved optimizing multi-circuit transmission lines using evolutionary computation and parallel computing techniques. As part of this work, I automated numerous tests using Python and Matlab, enabling seamless interaction with external software like PSCAD and ATP. Additionally, I have shared my knowledge by teaching Python, Fortran, and C to fellow researchers and professionals, with a specific focus on automating PSCAD simulations.

Beyond my research activities, I contribute as a volunteer reviewer for ELSEVIER Electric Power Systems Research. Moreover, I played an important role in the organization of the International Conference on Power Systems Transients (IPST) 2019, serving as the technical chair assistant.

I have gained practical engineering experience in Colombia, having worked on diverse projects ranging from service stations and project management to transmission lines.

My current areas of interest revolve around HVDC, transmission lines, transient analysis, optimization, machine learning, and bio-inspired algorithms. To enhance my knowledge in these domains, I have pursued relevant coursework in power systems, neural networks, and natural computing at the University of Campinas.

profile_positions.description: Currently, I am working on HVDC problems, using high-performance computing with PSCAD automation through Python.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description:
During this time I did the following activities:

1) I studied how to reduce the secondary arc current (SAC) in optimized transmission lines. For the reduction of the SAC two alternatives were evaluated. The first one consisted of the design of optimal neutral reactor arrangements,  and the second one of the design of optimal transmission lines with reduced SAC. For this research, I used Python, Matlab, and PSCAD. 
2) I participated in consulting projects, designing optimal transmission lines for companies. 
3) I teach how to do automated simulations in PSCAD, using Python, Fortran, and C.
4) I collaborated in researches related to arc current in DC systems, the corona effect, and rural electrification.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: My research was about the optimization of transmission lines using artificial intelligence, representing the problem from a multi-objective approach, and solving it using evolutionary computation.  The codes for solving the problem were implemented in Matlab, Python, and C#, resulting in the register of a computer program for generating optimal transmission lines. In the design of the optimized transmission lines,  I calculated electrical aspects such as electromagnetic fields, corona effect, steady-state operation, and transients caused by short-circuits, line energization, and load rejection. Also, I calculated the costs for building and maintaining the transmission lines. In the mechanical aspect, the weight and mass center of the towers were calculated.
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: During this time, I used parallel computing in PSCAD and Python for controlling PSCAD simulations and applying optimization techniques for reducing the secondary arc current in transmission lines.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Scholar

profile_positions.description: I participated in the design of 34.5 kV transmission lines. During this time I also developed an algorithm in Matlab to calculate the optimal wires for the transmission lines.
profile_positions.title: Electrical Design Engineer

profile_positions.description: During this time I was part of the project management team in the service station Salitre of Codensa. My main duties were to support the team in the management of the projects, and in the inspection of the safety protocols in the service stations that were being built during that time. To accelerate the procedures I automated the safety indicators calculations using Excel.
profile_positions.title: Electrical Engineering Intern

profile_positions.description: I worked as consulting engineer on a project between the Aerocivil of Colombia and the National University of Colombia, to design a Multilateration system for aircraft. My duties included the design of the Multirateration system, the design of the electrical feeder, and the preparation of normative documents.
profile_positions.title: Consulting Engineer

company.description:
Manitoba Hydro International Ltd. (MHI) provides innovative solutions to help customers in the energy sector. As a subsidiary of one of Canada’s most highly regarded energy utilities, Manitoba Hydro, we are proud to bring over a century’s worth of utility best practice experience and our global expertise to every customer we serve. 

As a strong and diversified centre of innovation, MHI operates right across the electricity market — from generation, through transmission and distribution, to the end user. For over 30 years, we have provided leading-edge services and products to our clients in over 120 countries around the world.

Whether working with a utility in Africa to deliver reliable energy for homes and schools or helping a business in Australia optimize their power usage, we strive to improve people’s lives around the world. We work closely with our clients to provide sustainable results, enhance local economic and social benefits, and deliver better outcomes for the lives we touch every day. 

Our clients turn to us to overcome even the most intricate and complex challenges, to deliver results on time and on budget, from start to finish, and in some of the most remote locations. Dedicated to delivering the right solutions for all your energy needs, we recognize that working together is key for a project’s long-term success.
